main event: In Van Nuys, California on April 19, 1951, a large, round, bright light was observed moving horizontally at a high speed and increasing in size. It disappeared from view behind some trees after approximately 2 minutes of observation.
interesting points: The object was initially described as the size of a basketball at arm's length and gradually increased in size as it approached the witness.
It was observed for about 2 minutes on a clear night with scattered clouds.
There were 8 photos taken as evidence of the sighting.
Another sighting on a different date described a large white object lying on the ground in an open field, measuring approximately 15 feet in diameter and 6 feet in height.
The witness reported that the object did not appear to be of human manufacture and had no visible means of propulsion or landing gear.
sighted object: large, round, bright light in the sky and a large white object on the ground
